item.title: Gethsemani Farms
item.description: In 1848, 44 Roman Catholic Trappist monks established the Abbey of Gethsemani in Kentucky. The Order of Cistercians of the Strict Observance follow the Rule of St. Benedict, focusing on peace, work, and prayer. Originally supporting themselves through farming, the monks now sell homemade fruitcakes, fudge, and more. Despite having the best bourbon fudge around,1 they needed help to make it a bit easier for their customers to buy more of it.
